intro: Eleutherococcus nodiflorus var. koreanus, commonly known as Korean angelica or Korean eleuthero, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to temperate climates. Its root system is often used in traditional medicine for its purported adaptogenic properties. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
